column4: Good afternoon everyone :) I got a problem that is recurring on other Ubuntu puters too, when I record sound I get a loud noise that sounds like a slow fan... Any idea why?
could be external noise, powerline hum, etc...
it ain't there in Vista
And it's way to loud to be external noise, it overpowers my voice
Wrong module?
Care to elaborate on that? :P
A module is what Windows folks call a driver.
This ugly little earpiece didn't come with drivers
nagatzul:ok, then you'll have to be more specific. A slow fan could be a lot of things?
Further it seems like it's mainly in aMSn... Let me get you a short clip
D'oh... Now I got bigger issues :P
What's the other issue? Don't bother sending me an audio, my speakerls aren't powered up.
It went from a distinct pulsing noise to giving me "[12:33:16] An error occured when trying to record the sound : Could not gain access to /dev/dsp for writing."
???? DSP sounds like digital signal processing, but what generates the errer?
The act of clicking the voiceclip button in amsn
*sigh* This is getting worse, now aMsn closed down instead when I clicked it...
Lemme just try the recorder in ubuntu first :P
Do you have Audacity installed?
Don't think so, however I noticed that it's fine in the regular recorder so it's an aMsn issue instead..
ok, so we are sure it is external, and not coming from your box?
It only happens in aMsn so yes, positive.
ok, I'm not familiar witht aMsn, but if that seems to be the problem, sniff on that. Could it be a connection issue?
